<div class="cv-section">
### Education

<div class="cv-entry">
#### MA Political Science
University of Oslo | Aug 2019 – Jun 2021
<p>In my thesis I used matching and logistic regression to measure the effect of legal capability on the decision-making of the European Court of Justice. My thesis was awarded a "Fritt Ord" scholarship and nominated for the "Våg-å-vite" prize. Supervisor: Silje Synnøve Lyder Hermansen</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### BA Political Science
University of Oslo | Aug 2015 – Jun 2019
<p>My thesis explored EU as a political cleavage with a particular focus on the differing positions of left- and right-wing political parties.</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cv-section">
### Positions

<div class="cv-entry">
#### PhD Candidate
ARENA, Centre for European Studies, University of Oslo | Sep 2022 – Present
<p>My dissertation explores how gendered selection bias shapes descriptive representation and women's careers within political institutions. Submission date: February 4th 2026. Defense to take place in May or June 2026. Supervisors: Øyvind Stiansen (University of Oslo), Daniel Naurin (University of Oslo), and Silje Synnøve Lyder Hermansen (Copenhagen University).</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### Advisor
Norway's Digitalisation Agency | Jan 2022 – Sep 2022
<p>Responsible for research requested by the Ministry of Local Government and Regional Development, facilitating re-use of public sector data, following EU legislation on data sharing.</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### PhD Candidate
European University Institute, Florence | Sep 2021 – Jan 2022
<p>Supervisor: Simon J. Hix</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### Data Scientist (summer job)
Department of Political Science, University of Oslo | Jun 2021 – Sep 2021
<p>Worked in a team that developed a program for learning applied statistics and programming in R. Project director: Bjørn Høyland.</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### Research Assistant
Department of Political Science, University of Oslo | Mar 2021 – Oct 2021
<p>Responsible for the collection, cleaning, and analysis of data for research focused on freedom of speech and scientific production in autocratic regimes, under the supervision of Professor Tore Wig.</p>
</div>

<div class="cv-entry">
#### Research Assistant
PluriCourts Research Center, Faculty of Law, University of Oslo | Jun 2020 – Sep 2021
<p>Contributed to the development of a comprehensive database on the European Court of Justice, encompassing all cases, both oral and written briefs, litigants, lawyers, and observing member states. Tasks included data scraping, collection, compilation, description, analysis, and presentation.</p>
</div>
</div>
